title: (x) Avenue of the Americas - (similar to) Carmina {Chesh}
content: The PC version of this delicate serif font is "Fritz". Does anyone know the Mac equivalent? !["Fritz" on the PC](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142114im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24062.jpg)
author: innocentdesignr

comments.content: It's seemingly based (both in form and in name) on [Friz Quadrata](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142114/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/friz-quadrata/friz-quadrata/testdrive.html?s=4010%20AVENUE%20OF%20THE%20AMERICAS&p=36).
Font Bureau has a font called Fritz, but it ain't that one.
Hard to tell from the sample, but it could be [Carmina Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142114/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/carmina/medium/testdrive.html?s=lalibgae%2BAVENUE&p=48).

Eagle eyes do it agin.   
Yep, Fritz / Friz it is. And I always thought it was "Fritz Quadrata".

I disagree. Friz Quadrata is very different in certain ways: look at the g and e in the lower-case, and look at the overall contrast between thicks and thins -- Friz has a much lower contrast than this face, which, I believe, is much closer to the Carmina I identified earlier.
I knew Friz Quadrata, Friz Quadrata was a friend of mine, and you're no Friz.

I think Chesh is right. Probably a knock-off of Carmina. The character shapes are there, but the spacing is horrible. You often see that with knock-offs. And, it's definitely not Friz.   
   
Also: Note to Mark Taylor: Carmina is not "the Mac equivalent" of your Fritz font. Carmina is the original and is available for both Windows and Mac. Fritz is just a bad copy. There may or may not be a Mac version of it. You would be better off with Carmina unless you absolutely must have that bad spacing.
